meanings.definition: Imitating or resembling the style of classical antiquity.
meanings.sent1: The artist created a pseudoclassic sculpture for the museum exhibit.
meanings.sent2: The building's facade had a pseudoclassic design with columns and intricate carvings.
meanings.sent3: The pseudoclassic painting fooled many into thinking it was from ancient times.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was a pseudoclassic masterpiece, blending modern and ancient styles.
meanings.sent5: The garden was transformed into a pseudoclassic paradise with marble statues and fountains.

meanings.definition: A work of art or literature that imitates the style of classical antiquity.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a pseudoclassic vase from the Roman era.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed reading pseudoclassic novels that transported her to ancient times.
meanings.sent3: The play was a pseudoclassic comedy, mixing modern humor with ancient themes.
meanings.sent4: His poetry collection was a pseudoclassic treasure trove of ancient-inspired verses.
meanings.sent5: The library had a section dedicated to pseudoclassic literature, attracting history enthusiasts.

meanings.definition: Falsely or erroneously considered to be a classic.
meanings.sent1: The pseudoclassic car was actually a replica made in the 2000s.
meanings.sent2: The painting was deemed pseudoclassic by mistake due to its aged appearance.
meanings.sent3: He proudly displayed his pseudoclassic watch, unaware of its true origin.
meanings.sent4: The vase turned out to be pseudoclassic, fooling even the experts at the auction.
meanings.sent5: The antique dealer mistakenly labeled the mirror as pseudoclassic, leading to confusion among buyers.
